required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PEEZY Midstream Urine Device Compared to Catheterized Urine Sample
clinical_study.official_title: Midstream Urine Collection Device Compared to Catheterized Sample: Contamination and Patient Satisfaction.

brief_summary.textblock: Urine culture and microscopic urinalysis will be compared between 2 collection methods: PEEZY midstream urine collection, and urethral catheter collection.

detailed_description.textblock:
Female patients presenting to the Baylor Scott & White Health (Temple, TX) Urology clinic for complaints of lower urinary tract symptoms will be included. They will be approached by a clinical research coordinator and given more information. If they meet eligibility by screening, consents will be completed.
Patients will proceed with their regular clinic visit with their clinician. Just prior to the physical exam, patients will use the PEEZY device to give a urine specimen in the privacy of the bathroom. The package with PEEZY includes the simple instructions for use. Patients return to the clinic room and the physical exam proceeds. An in-and-out catheter is used to obtain a post-void residual as well as a control urine specimen. After the remainder of the patient routine exam is complete, they will fill out a brief questionnaire.
The 2 specimens will then be delivered to the lab. The clinical research coordinator will store consents and questionnaires that include the subjects study identification number in individual opaque envelopes that will be kept in a locked drawer accessible to only the investigators.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patient spontaneously voids in the bathroom using PEEZY (research sample). Within 10 minutes, patient is catheterized during physical exam (control sample) for post-void residual.

primary_outcome.measure: Contamination of urine specimen with urethral and vaginal flora
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 specimens from each subject (1 from each arm) will be taken to the lab for urinalysis and culture immediately after specimens are given. Culture results will be reported in 48 hours. After results are recorded, no further assessment of this outcome.
primary_outcome.description: Contamination defined as: presence of urethral or vaginal flora on urine culture OR epithelial cell presence in urinalysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale (this is the only title for this scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Performed one time immediately after intervention. This will not be repeated.
secondary_outcome.description: On a questionnaire: patient rates level of distress experienced during each urine donation method. The scale is from 1 to 10. On this scale 10 is associated with the word "agonizing", 8 is associated with "horrible", 4 is associated with "uncomfortable", 2 is associated with "annoying", and 0 is associated with "None". Unbearable distress is marked near 10. No distress is marked near 0. On this scale responses can only be reported as a number from 0-10, and a lower number indicates a better outcome. There are no subscales.

other_outcome.time_frame: Performed one time immediately after intervention. This will not be repeated.
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire created by investigator asks: Which way would you prefer to give a urine sample, if needed in the future? PEEZY or catheter.

arm_group.description: All subjects will use PEEZY to give a urine specimen.
All subjects will use CATHETER (performed by their clinician) to give a urine specimen, following PEEZY use.

intervention.description: In-and-out catheter obtains urine through the urethra.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females presenting to the Urology or Urogynecology clinic for consultation or evaluation of lower urinary tract complaints.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known pregnancy
- Use of antimicrobial oral or vaginal therapy in the past 4 weeks
- Use of Pyridium in the past 4 weeks
